content.question: Which of the following best describes the trend in the data for the Communist Party?

choices.label: The Communist Party has consistently been one of the top three parties to receive seats in the Duma, and it was the largest party in 1999.
Since 1993 the Communist Party has consistently been in government leadership as a coalition partner.
The popularity of the Communist Party in Russia has declined over time, and so has the number of seats the party has in the Duma.
The Communist Party is supported only by older people and people who do not like President Putin.

content.answer: The Communist Party has consistently been one of the top three parties to receive seats in the Duma, and it was the largest party in 1999.
